androidx.leanback.widget

Class GuidedDatePickerAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.leanback.widget.Action
      • androidx.leanback.widget.GuidedAction
        • androidx.leanback.widget.GuidedDatePickerAction

  • public class GuidedDatePickerAction
extends GuidedAction
    Subclass of GuidedAction that can choose a date. The Action is editable by default; to make it read only, call hasEditableActivatorView(false) on the Builder.

    • Method Detail

      • getDatePickerFormat

        public java.lang.String getDatePickerFormat()
        Returns format of date Picker or null if not specified. The format is a case insensitive String containing the * day ('d'), month ('m'), and year ('y'). When the format is not specified, a default format of current locale will be used.
        Returns:
        Format of showing Date, e.g. "YMD". Returns null if using current locale's default.

      • getDate

        public long getDate()
        Get current value of DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in TimeZone.getDefault() time zone.
        Returns:
        Current value of DatePicker Action.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(long date)
        Sets current value of DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in TimeZone.getDefault() time zone.
        Parameters:
        date - New value to update current value of DatePicker Action.

      • getMinDate

        public long getMinDate()
        Get minimal value of DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in TimeZone.getDefault() time zone. -1 if not set.
        Returns:
        Minimal value of DatePicker Action or Long.MIN_VALUE if not set.

      • getMaxDate

        public long getMaxDate()
        Get maximum value of DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in TimeZone.getDefault() time zone.
        Returns:
        Maximum value of DatePicker Action or Long.MAX_VALUE if not set.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle bundle,
                                java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from class: GuidedAction
        Save action into a bundle using a given key. When isAutoRestoreEna() is true:
      • GuidedAction.isEditable() is true: save text of GuidedAction.getTitle()
      • GuidedAction.isDescriptionEditable() is true: save text of GuidedAction.getDescription()
      • GuidedAction.getCheckSetId() is not GuidedAction.NO_CHECK_SET: save GuidedAction.isChecked()}
      • GuidedDatePickerAction will be saved
        • Subclass may override this method.
Overrides:
onSaveInstanceState in class GuidedAction
Parameters:
bundle - Bundle to save the Action.
key - Key used to save the Action.

  • onRestoreInstanceState

    public void onRestoreInstanceState(Bundle bundle,
                                   java.lang.String key)
    Description copied from class: GuidedAction
    Restore action from a bundle using a given key. When isAutoRestore() is true:
  • GuidedAction.isEditable() is true: save text of GuidedAction.getTitle()
  • GuidedAction.isDescriptionEditable() is true: save text of GuidedAction.getDescription()
  • GuidedAction.getCheckSetId() is not GuidedAction.NO_CHECK_SET: save GuidedAction.isChecked()}
  • GuidedDatePickerAction will be saved

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
